# freeipa_user_group_membership (Resource)

Manages membership of users and groups in a FreeIPA group. This resource allows you to add individual users or nested groups to a parent group.

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Configure provider
provider "freeipa" {
  host               = "ipa.example.com"
  kerberos_enabled   = true
  kerberos_principal = "terraform/ipa.example.com@EXAMPLE.COM"
  kerberos_realm     = "EXAMPLE.COM"
  keytab_path        = "/etc/krb5.keytab"
}

# Create groups
resource "freeipa_group" "developers" {
  cn          = "developers"
  description = "Development team"
}

resource "freeipa_group" "senior_developers" {
  cn          = "senior-developers"
  description = "Senior development team"
}

resource "freeipa_group" "all_engineering" {
  cn          = "all-engineering"
  description = "All engineering staff"
}

# Create users
resource "freeipa_user" "john" {
  name       = "jdoe"
  first_name = "John"
  last_name  = "Doe"
}

resource "freeipa_user" "jane" {
  name       = "jsmith"
  first_name = "Jane"
  last_name  = "Smith"
}

# Add individual user to group
resource "freeipa_user_group_membership" "john_to_developers" {
  name = freeipa_group.developers.cn
  user = freeipa_user.john.name
}

# Add another user to the same group
resource "freeipa_user_group_membership" "jane_to_developers" {
  name = freeipa_group.developers.cn
  user = freeipa_user.jane.name
}

# Add user to senior developers group
resource "freeipa_user_group_membership" "jane_to_senior" {
  name = freeipa_group.senior_developers.cn
  user = freeipa_user.jane.name
}

# Add nested group (developers is a member of all-engineering)
resource "freeipa_user_group_membership" "developers_to_engineering" {
  name  = freeipa_group.all_engineering.cn
  group = freeipa_group.developers.cn
}

# Add another nested group
resource "freeipa_user_group_membership" "seniors_to_engineering" {
  name  = freeipa_group.all_engineering.cn
  group = freeipa_group.senior_developers.cn
}
```

## Notes

- Each resource manages a single user or group membership
- To add multiple users to a group, create multiple `freeipa_user_group_membership` resources
- You can add either a `user` or a `group`, but not both in the same resource
- Nested groups allow for hierarchical group structures

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Group name

### Optional

- `group` (String) Group to add
- `user` (String) User to add

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) The ID of this resource.
